meta.title: 06-04-2025 — Suicide Attempt Disclosed from Hospital; Not Logged Until 17-04-2025
parties: Sussex Police (OIC PC Jon Dixon; supervisors Sgt Duffy, Insp Palmer)
legal_mapping: Victims’ Code — Right to be kept informed; to be treated with respect and sensitivity
ECHR Article 2 — operational duty to take reasonable steps to safeguard life
College of Policing (stalking/harassment; vulnerable victims) — accurate recording & follow-up

claim_summary: On 06-04-2025, from hospital, the victim disclosed a suicide attempt to the officer in charge. The incident was not entered on police systems until 17-04-2025, during a period when the OIC and both supervisors were on leave. No timely safeguarding actions or welfare check are recorded in the interim.

contradictions.claim: Suicide attempt disclosed on 06-04-2025 was only logged on 17-04-2025.
impact: Safeguarding delay during acute risk window
Grounds for supervisory/PSD review and IOPC referral consideration

contradictions.claim: OIC and supervisors were simultaneously on leave during the critical period.
impact: Continuity gap; escalation bottleneck; unmanaged risk

contradictions.claim: No welfare check or proactive contact recorded between 06–17 April.
impact: Victims’ Code concern; operational safeguarding lapse

key_quotes.note: Complaints call confirms suicide on 06-04 and log entry on 17-04.
101 call shows status confusion and chain-on-leave context.

timeline_hooks.note: Suicide attempt disclosed from hospital to police (OIC).
Incident first appears as logged on system.
